result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Zuercher Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (7/15/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant shall not use or possess prescription drugs unless currently prescribed to the Defendant and taken in accordance with the prescribing physician's directions.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom. Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: with work release and transfer privileges. Huber may be used for treatment/counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy J. Zuercher in court, in custody with attorney Brian J. Smith.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Jackie Braunschweig appears by phone. Court questions all parties regarding revocation packet - all parties have received it and have no objections. Court heard, finds victim rights compliance. Atty Tienstra heard on argument. Court heard, finds 63 days of present. credit.  Atty Smith heard on argument. Def. makes statement. Court heard, imposes sent.:

5 mos DCJ w/ H&T to comm. forthwith; huber may be used for treatment/counseling
Civil judgment for any unpaid fees.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

9:10 - Defendant, Timothy J. Zuercher in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with APM w/m dob 10/28/63 and his residence.  Return date scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
